001package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
002
003import java.awt.Shape;
004import java.awt.geom.FlatteningPathIterator;
005import java.awt.geom.PathIterator;
006import java.util.Iterator;
007
008import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
009
010/**
011 * A small wrapper class to create a simple {@link Iterator} of
012 * {@link Pnt2d} to step over the individual points of
013 * a AWT {@link Shape} object. Curved shapes are flattened by a
014 * {@link FlatteningPathIterator}.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @see PathIterator
018 * @see FlatteningPathIterator
019 */
020public class ShapePointIterator implements Iterator<Pnt2d> {
021        
022        private final PathIterator pi;
023        private final double coords[] = new double[6];
024        
025        public ShapePointIterator(Shape s, double flatness) {
026                this.pi = s.getPathIterator(null, flatness);
027        }
028
029        @Override
030        public boolean hasNext() {
031                return !pi.isDone();
032        }
033
034        @Override
035        public Pnt2d next() {
036                if (pi.isDone()) {
037                        return null;
038                }
039                else {
040                        pi.currentSegment(coords);
041                        pi.next();
042                        return Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]);
043                }
044        }
045
046        
047//      public static void main(String[] args) {
048//              Pnt2d ctr = Pnt2d.from(20, 30);
049//              GeometricCircle gc = new GeometricCircle(20, 30, 100);
050//              Shape circle = gc.getShape();
051//              System.out.println("circle = " + circle);
052//              
053////            ShapePointIterator iter = new ShapePointIterator(circle, 0.01);
054////            while(iter.hasNext()) {
055////                    Pnt2d p = iter.next();
056////                    System.out.println(p + " dist = " + gc.getDistance(p));
057////            }
058//              
059//              System.out.println("checkShape = " + gc.checkShape(circle, 0.5));
060//              
061//      }
062}
